abstract: The agreement settles a class-action lawsuit that accused the discount retail giant of cutting workers’ break time and allowing employees to work off the clock in Minnesota.
snippet: The agreement settles a class-action lawsuit that accused the discount retail giant of cutting workers’ break time and allowing employees to work off the clock in Minnesota.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores announced a $54.25 million settlement on Tuesday of a lawsuit accusing it of wage violations in Minnesota  far less than the $2 billion in fines that it was threatened with when a judge ruled against it last July.

headline.main: Wal-Mart to Pay $54 Million to Settle Suit Over Wages
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart to Pay $54 Million To Settle Suit Over Wages
